reasoning: Perianal/anal fistula incidence from epidemiological studies: 1-3 per 10,000 person-years = 10-30 per 100k. Global average ~18 per 100k per year. Associated with Crohn's disease, trauma, and infection. Prevalence higher (~25 per 100k) as many cases become chronic. Strong epidemiological evidence from colorectal/gastroenterology registries and population studies.
source: Lunniss PJ et al. (2009). Handbook of Anal Fistula. London: Springer. Based on UK inflammatory bowel disease registry data.
